bwwExcerpt: Yes, she's better than Lassie or Toto or even Uggie; she certainly beats out any animal trained by William Berloni. Her only competition may be Snoopy. Ashford's consistently hilarious, sometimes touching, always spot-on canine impersonation is the reason to see the first Broadway production of A.R. Gurney's play about a man who falls in love with a stray dog that he finds in the park, endangering his marriage...The strength of Gurney's play is in the precise observations of a dog's behavior and
